problem: A nonagon (9-sided polygon) has sides of lengths 2, 3, 2, 3, 2, 3, 2, 3, and 2 units. If it is equiangular, find the sum of the internal angles of the polygon.
solution: The sum of the internal angles of a polygon with $n$ sides is given by $180(n-2)$ degrees. For a nonagon, $n = 9$. Thus, the sum of the internal angles is $180(9-2) = 180 \times 7 = 1260$ degrees. \(\boxed{1260^\circ}\)
